comments.text:
English is funny. It's silly to spell sophomore like that. The way you 
spell it makes more sense lol.
comments.author: prettyinpink9893

top_comment.text:
Hey.
You know... since I was a little girl, I always envied black girls hair. It 
was a kind of obsession of mine. Because my hair is curly... really 
curly... and because I got some racist remarks about it from my own family 
(and Im white, but my hair dosent behave like a good white girl's hair) I 
always thought I was entitled to ask black women about their hair and ask 
to touch it... Im brazilian, but I lived in vancouver for some months and I 
was always the only curled haired person in the room and a lot of people 
asked me to touch my hair. At the beginning it was finny, but that 
obsession in touching me builded up a bit and I didnt like all that 
attention to it. You know, my hair has its own life, believes and 
particularities... al those people touching it was making my hair sad and 
losing my curls... Anyways, I watched a video by you about the issue of 
black woman's hair and two things happened: 1. I identified a bit (because 
of vancouver) and I stopped asking to touch people's hair. I am sorry if I 
was stupid. No, I still a stupid person, but doing at least one last stupid 
thing. One last thing: sorry for my bad english.﻿
top_comment.author: Bárbara Nunes

comments.text:
Awwww it's ok. We understand and most of us Just let them touch it to a 
certain extent...
comments.author: Giovanni Casson

comments.text:
+Destinee Starr Yes hun its downgrading yourself. When a person compliments 
you and you show disapproval thats what it is. She isnt talking about white 
girls but how she likes (your) BLACK beauty. And she is right you're 
gorgeous!
comments.author: mari omari

comments.text:
+mari omari I'm not downgrading myself I'm just being honest. I'm not the 
only black girl that feels likes white girls have it better
comments.author: Des

comments.text: +Destinee Starr lol dont downgrade yourself wth.
comments.author: mari omari

comments.text:
Trust me there is nothing to be envious of. You're so lucky to be a white 
girl. You have beautiful hair and men love you so be grateful

comments.author: Astrid Mayanka

captions.text:
- [Voiceover] You asked
for it, so here it is.
This is Draw My Life.

You'd better appreciate it,
'cause this is the third time

I'm trying this, 'cause this
is actually really hard.
So, I was born in '83 in November.
Sagittarius, baby, what?
In West Beach, Florida, which is probably
where your grandparents live.
As the only child born to my mom and dad.
♫ There were three in the family ♫

And we were very happy until
we weren't so happy anymore,
and my parents got a divorce.
Truthfully, I don't really remember
that much about the divorce.

But I remember we were
learning how to tell time,

and I cried through the entire
lesson, and to this day,
I'm still really bad at telling time.

In second grade, I went
to St. Ann's, which is
a Catholic school.
And I was a little apprehensive at first,
'cause I'm not Catholic.
But my mom was totally sold on it,
because I'd have to wear a uniform,

which is a really great
way to save money, I guess.

But it ended up actually
being really cool.

And in third grade, we
had to keep a journal
as part of an assignment.
And I really loved it.

I actually kept a journal
all the way through college,
and I still have all of them.

St. Ann's is also where I fell
in love with the computer.

Computer class was my absolute
favorite, and I'm pretty sure

it has a lot to do with why
I'm such a computer nerd
to this very day.
In seventh grade, I got accepted to

Dreyfoos School of the
Arts, which is a middle
and high school for the performing arts

and actually, one of the
best in the country, woop!

They had dance, music,
art, communications.
But I decided to go to school for theater.

Now, when I got to Dreyfoos,
I was kind of nerdy,

'cause I had always worn a
uniform, and I didn't have
that many cool clothes.

And I was super insecure
about the way that I looked.
And a lot of the kids made fun of me,
and I felt really left out.

It didn't help that I was
already insecure about my looks.
Mainly, my boobs.
I was convinced that I had lopsided tits,

and truthfully, I did,
because everyone does.
Usually your left is bigger,
because that's where your heart is.
The more you know.

In eighth grade, my mom
sent me to computer camp,
where I learned HTML and coding,
and I even built my own website.

And I was so excited about
it that I decided to start
my own online journal.

In ninth grade, things didn't
get that much better for me,
because I had a really bad dye job,

and a lot of my hair fell
out, so I had to cut it

into this really short,
like, pixie cut thing.

But it actually ended
up being really cute,
and I felt way more self-confident.

And I realized that I was
really funny, and I started

making tons of friends and
becoming really popular.
But it started to kind of go to my head,
and I turned into this huge bitch.

I realized that I could
use my humor to cover up

my insecurities, which
seemed like a good idea,
since I was so popular.

But what's the use in being
popular if no one likes you?
My senior year I got a scholarship to the

University of Michigan for
acting, so packed up my stuff
and headed to the chilly north.
When I got to school, not much changed.

I still kept that stinky
attitude, and it ended up

pushing me away from a
lot of my classmates,
so I didn't have very many friends.
I got stuck in this class with this girl
that I absolutely hated, and we had to
work together all the time.

But slowly I realized
that she was really cool,
and we became good friends.
One day she confronted me and said,

"Listen, I like you a lot,
but I don't understand
"why you used to be such a bitch."

And when I thought about
it, I realized that she had
all the things that I wish I had,
and I was really just jealous of her.

I was so embarrassed that
I had let my insecurites
get in the way of living my life.
Thankfully, she was able to forgive me,

and we're actually still good
friends to this very day.

Sophomore year, my scholarship
didn't get renewed,
and I had to take out a bunch of loans,
and I was really stressed out.
Then I got a job on campus working on

one of the school's websites,
which gave me an amazing idea.

I thought, maybe I should
go to school for this
instead of acting.

So I applied to school in
Florida, packed up my bags,
and headed home to study graphic design.

Around this time, I decided
that I wanted to go natural,
so I cut all my hair off.

And then I decided that
I wanted to start locks.

I poked around on the
internet looking for help,
but I couldn't really find anything.

So I decided to start my own
blog about my hair journey.

One Thanksgiving, I went
to a party that was being

thrown by some people I
went to high school with.

And Patrick, who I also
went to high school with,
ended up being at the party.

By the end of the night, it
was me, Patrick, and this

other girl, whose name I
don't remember hanging out.

And she had a bunch of
eyeball tattoos, and I was
certain that she and Patrick were dating.
But it turned out that he was actually
interested in me and not her.
And then, we started to go out.

After that I graduated from
school and as my graduation gift

my dad bought me a new iMac
that had a built-in camera,
which I was really excited about.

Shortly after, I started
doing standup and entering
lots of contests.

And then I discovered
YouTube was having a contest
to go to the Emmys.
So, I entered, and I won.

I got flown to the red
carpet, where I interviewed

lots of celebrities, and
it was really awesome.

And I thought, this is the
life that I wanna live.

So Patrick and I decided that
we would move from Florida
to New York with our two dogs,
so that Patrick could go to law school
and I could try to become a comedian.

But instead, I got
stuck working long hours
at all my graphic design jobs.
So I decided to get more into YouTube.

In 2011 I entered the YouTube
NextUp contest, and I won.
I got a bunch of money and cameras

and training at YouTube
to make my videos better.

Shortly after, I had a
freelance client that was

going to France on business
and asked me to tag along.

One day, I was hanging
out by the Eiffel Tower,

and I turned around,
and Patrick was there.
I was absolutely flabbergasted.

And then it got better, because
he asked me to marry him.
And of course I said yes.

When we got back to the
States, there was this video

that was really blowing up
called "Shit Girls Say",
and everyone was making parodies.

But I couldn't come up
with an idea of my own.

It wasn't until I was at a
Christmas party back in Florida,

where at the end of the
night, everyone started

touching my dreads and asking
me if my hair was real.

And I thought, "This would
make a great idea for a video."
So, when I got back to New York,

I made "Shit White Girls
Say to Black Girls,"
and to my surprise, it was a hit.

I went viral with over 9
million views, and I was able

to quit my job as a graphic
designer and finally start

living my dream of being
an actor, comedian,
something or other.
I was getting calls from everyone.
MTV, Anderson Cooper, NPR,
MSNBC, I got an agent and a manager.
Things were going really good.

I spent all of 2012 performing
all over the country,
doing TV, going on auditions.
Life was great.

I even got a chance to
develop my own TV show
with a major cable network.
But after spending a year working on it,

they decided to pass, and I
was really bummed about it.
I'd been so busy that I wasn't really able
to focus on YouTube,
and my video views started going way down.
And then the phone stopped ringing.
And work just wasn't really coming in
the way that I wanted it to.

Then I realized that I'm
kind of at this crossroads.

Like what am I supposed
to do with my life?

Like should I be more practical
and just get a regular job,
or should I keep doing YouTube,

which is something that
I really like and love.

But what I need right now
is stability and money.
And I have neither of those, and instead
I have a lot of stress.

I'm starting to feel
like time is running out.
Like I'm getting too old for this.
What am I doing?

Not to mention I'm supposed
to try and get married

this year, and I just
don't know how I'm going to
make all of it happen.

Even though I'm stressed
out and confused and just
don't really know what I'm doing,
I realize I have a lot to be thankful for.

First, I have YouTube, which
has been so good to me,
and I've made so many amazing friends
and gotten great opportunities from it.

I also have an amazing
fiancee, two dogs that I love,
and pretty sweet parents.
So, even though I feel really confused,

and I don't know what I
want to do with myself,
I know that whatever I choose,
they'll be there to support me.
And eventually, I'll figure it out.
So yeah, that's it, the end.
